paper_abstract: We give deterministic polynomial time algorithms for two different decision version the modular inversion hidden number problem introduced by D. Boneh, S. Halevi and N. A. Howgrave-Graham in 2001. For example, for one of our algorithms we need to be given about 1/2 of the bits of each inversion, while for the computational version the best known algorithm requires about 2/3 of the bits and is probabilistic.
paper_title: CLOSE VALUES OF SHIFTED MODULAR INVERSIONS AND THE DECISIONAL MODULAR INVERSION HIDDEN NUMBER PROBLEM
